Whatâ€™s going on, XRP holders. Hereâ€™s a clear bit of perspective on why onchain meme coins and NFTs actually matter.

If you look at Solana, BNB, Ethereum and others, every major run to all time highs was backed by massive onchain activity. NFTs in 2021 and 2023. Meme coins driving volume. That activity forces people to buy the native asset, move it onchain, and use it. Thatâ€™s what creates demand, liquidity, and real price discovery.

Meme coins arenâ€™t everyoneâ€™s taste, but history is very clear: they are one of the most powerful onboarding and volume engines crypto has ever had.

Now look at the XRPL side of things.

The XRPL meme ecosystem is still very new. The largest meme coin ever peaked around ~$100M. Today, the biggest projects sit under ~$10M. Daily meme coin volume across the ledger is roughly ~$5M. Compare that to Solana or BNB doing tens of billions per day even today during bearish times. 

That gap alone shows how early this is. Weâ€™re talking a potential 1,000x expansion in onchain activity, not speculation pulled out of thin air.

XRP is a top three crypto by market cap, with a ~$200B valuation, yet its largest memes are still tiny by comparison. Even chains like AVAX, ADA, and others already have meme coins valued in the hundreds of millions or billions. Itâ€™s unrealistic to think XRP wonâ€™t follow the same path as adoption and liquidity increase.

Meme coins help:
> Lock XRP on-chain
> Drive volume and fees
> Accelerate price discovery
> Onboard new users fast

Learning how the XRPL meme economy works isnâ€™t just about upside. Itâ€™s about supporting the ecosystem while positioning yourself to potentially compound more XRP along the way.

Early doesnâ€™t last forever.

Follow us to learn more.

Crypto 2025 Wrapped vibes.

This year was like three cycles compressed into one.

It started with memecoins and politics.

TRUMP launches days before inauguration.

MELANIA rugs.

Ross Ulbricht gets pardoned.

Total crypto market cap clears $4T.

Memecoin supercycle officially arrives.

February was the reminder.

Bybit hacked for $1.5B.

Bitcoin drops 20%+.

LIBRA implodes after Milei promotion.

Solana inflation debate divides CT.

Security fear spreads across exchanges.

March flips our sentiment again.

Trump announces a US crypto strategic reserve.

BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP named publicly.

RedStone TGE prints.

Binance Wallet activity explodes.

April humbles everyone.

Tariff fears trigger a sharp crash.

BTC dips below $100k.

Tokenize everything becomes new narrative.

May was historic.

US states approve Bitcoin 
reserve laws.

BTC hits $112k ATH.

Ethereum Pectra upgrade ships.

Coinbase joins the S&P 500.

Sui gets hacked because crypto never stays quiet.

June and July belonged to builders and regulators.

DeFi TVL recovers fast.

Aave crosses $24B, then becomes DeFi king.

GENIUS + CLARITY Acts signed.

BTC hits $118k ATH.

Ethereum turns 10.

Solana ETF goes live.

August goes full risk-on.

ETH hits $4,948 ATH.

DeFi TVL explodes.

Perps go mainstream.

PumpFun sells tokens.

BNB did new ATH.

September refuses to dump.

Fed cuts rates.

Regulators finally align.

OP_RETURN splits Crypto Twitter.

Creator capital markets emerge.

October reminds everyone volatility never left.

BTC breaks $126k.

Trump tariff comments nuke markets.

Mass liquidations.

USDe briefly depegs.

CZ gets a presidential pardon.

November turns cautious.

Bear market memes return.

Altseason hope whispers.

LINK ETF rumors circulate.

December closes strong.

ETF inflows return.

Robinhood launches alt perps in the EU.

Perp DEXes become narrative of the year.

Bittensor halving hits.

Stablecoins reach record usage.

If you survived 2025, you earned scar tissue.

Btw how was the year for you?

$BNB failed to hold above the 900â€“905 resistance zone and faced immediate rejection, confirming strong selling pressure at the highs. The recent upside move looks like a liquidity grab rather than real strength, followed by sharp rejection and bearish follow-through.

On the lower timeframe, price is trading below key resistance and struggling to reclaim previous support, showing that buyers are losing control. Volume increased during the drop, which supports continuation rather than reversal.

From a broader market perspective, overall sentiment remains cautious, and with BTC still unstable, upside momentum for $BNB is limited. Until price reclaims and holds above 912, longs remain risky and shorts offer better risk-to-reward.

895 â€“ 905 â†’ Ideal short entry
